(of) a measurement of temperature on a standard in which 0° is the temperature at which water freezes, and 100° the temperature at which it boils: Are the temperatures given in Celsius or Fahrenheit? The sample was heated to (a temperature of) 80°C. Compare
Fahrenheit
More examplesFewer examplesThe thermometer recorded a temperature of 30 degrees Celsius.In a strict sense, frost refers simply to a temperature of zero degrees Celsius or less.Preheat the oven to a temperature of 200 degrees Celsius.How do you convert 70 degrees Fahrenheit into Celsius?They always use the Celsius scale on the weather forecast nowadays.
